data.chText: 袍服，礼袍（常于典礼中穿着以显示身份）
data.enText: a long loose outer piece of clothing, especially one worn as a sign of rank or office at a special ceremony
to dress sb/yourself in long loose clothes or in the way mentioned
The priests were robed in black.

means: 袍服，礼袍(常于典礼中穿着以显示身份)

tr: outerwear consisting of a long flowing garment used for official or ceremonial occasions

example: the mountain was clothed in tropical trees

value.def: A robe is a loose piece of clothing which covers all of your body and reaches the ground. You can describe someone as wearing a robe or as wearing robes .

example.ex: Pope John Paul II knelt in his white robes before the simple altar.
example.tran: 教皇约翰·保罗二世身着白色长袍在简朴的圣坛前面跪下来。
毛皮衬里的绿色丝绸长袍

value.def: A robe is a piece of clothing, usually made of towelling, which people wear in the house, especially when they have just got up or had a bath.

example.ex: Ryle put on a robe and went down to the kitchen.
example.tran: 赖尔穿上睡袍，下楼去了厨房。
